text: English grammar lesson 24 topic articles
with places and geographical names my
husband thinks our family needs a change
of scenery
he works everyday in the city and while
the children I spend most of our time
here in the suburbs so where are we
going
I'll give you a clue a few clues
we're going to the beach but not just
any beach we have our passports and
we're going to Jamaica now I've been to
the Caribbean before at one point I
worked in the Bahamas but I've never
been to Jamaica so I'm really looking
forward to our trip
in this lesson I'd like to help you
learn some guidelines for using articles
with places and geographical names for
example I said the city the suburbs the
beach the Bahamas but I used no article
with Jamaica why is that I'll help you
learn the answer to that question
[Music]
when we want to explain where someone is
that is the person's general location
and perhaps the activity the person is
engaged in the activity they're doing
right now we use the preposition like at
or - plus a noun
with no article zero article for example
right now I'm at home my husband is at
work and my children are at school where
are we going we're going on vacation
question where are you right now at home
at work
[Music]
when we talk about the type of area
someone can live in or be in we use the
definite article thumb
plus a now as in the city the suburbs
the beach I live in the suburbs where is
your home is it in the suburbs or in the
city perhaps you have relatives who live
in the country or the countryside where
would your dream home be would it be in
the beach or the mountains when we talk
about places around town we're mostly
talking about public buildings in this
case we use the definite article the
plus account noun for example I went to
the post office to get my daughter her
passport the rest of us already had ours
I also went to the pharmacy to get some
medicine and I have yet to go to the
bank to get some money
[Music]
some places around town are owned and
operated by an individual one person in
this case we also use the definite
article duh and the name of the person
often in the possessive for example I
went to the doctor's I went to the
dentist's someone came from the florists
to deliver this bouquet to me it's from
my cousin then they sent it to me for
Mother's Day note we actually use this
structure the plus a possessive noun in
two cases with a person's business and
with a family's home look at the first
set of examples I went to the doctors
we're using the plus a possessive noun
because we have the type of work the
type of profession the doctors we could
also say I went to the florists the
butchers the dentists it's the person's
place of work a shop or an office but
next example Wendy's is a fast-food
restaurant like McDonald's here we're
not using the definite article because a
first or last name is the name of the
business and our final example we're
invited to the Smiths a family's home
[Music]
we also use the definite article duh
plus the name of a specific building a
building such as a hotel or museum or
government building that's why we say
the White House the Kremlin
the Boston Science Museum the Marriott
hotel question do you remember where you
were yesterday name all the places you
went to in the order you visited them
for example I went to the dentists then
I stopped at the pharmacy
[Music]
to talk about someone being in a place
that's an institution we use the zero
article no article for example at church
in college do you know anyone in college
are you in college
[Music]
you know that my family is taking a trip
we're going to Jamaica we're going to
fly from Boston to Jamaica our home is
actually in the suburbs of Boston Boston
Massachusetts in the United States of
America when we talk about geographical
names we often don't need an article we
don't need an article before most names
of cities states and countries the
exception would be countries with an S
at the end of the name plural names for
example the United States these names
are countries with groups of states
groups of Republic's or groups of
islands that's why I said the Bahamas
and the United States but I didn't say
the in front of Jamaica note let's add
continents to the list of geographical
names that are used with the zero
article use no article before Africa
Antarctica Asia Australia Europe North
and South America question do you have
plans to travel name cities or countries
you'd like to visit
I told you that most names of countries
don't require an article but regions do
we use the definite article the plus the
name of a region for example the Middle
East the Bermuda Triangle note when
speaking of the u.s. Americans say the
North to refer to northern states the
south the west and the East to refer to
States in those regions however the East
could only refer to northeastern states
exceptions would be the more
conversational phrases out west and back
east in those phrases no article is used
question are people basically the same
in all parts of your country can you
describe any differences from region to
region
[Music]
names of lakes and mountains are like
names of countries in that we usually
use the zero article the exception would
be groups groups of length groups of
mountain ranges for example we say Mount
Everest but we say the Himalayas the
Rocky Mountains I can tell you about
Lake Erie and Lake Michigan and Lake
Superior but I'll say the Great Lakes
because I'm talking about a group of
five lakes
[Music]
names of oceans rivers and seas require
the definite article for example I've
traveled along the Mississippi River and
I've been to the Black Sea questions one
can you name all the oceans
- how many seas can you name three
how many lakes and rivers have you seen
in your country
[Music]
there's one more place we haven't talked
about outer space astronauts take
shuttles in they go to space we use the
zero article before the words space and
outer space to talk about that place
beyond Earth's atmosphere we also use
the zero article before names of planets
such as Mars and Venus the exception
would be to use the definite article
with the Sun the moon because they're
unique and they're specific we know
which moon in which Sun we're talking
about our moon and our Sun note Earth is
actually used with and without the
definite article to simply name our
planet no article is needed as in we
live on planet Earth however to name
something specific on our planet or
about our planet we usually use the
definite article for example the Earth's
rotation the surface of the earth when
we use earth to mean our world we often
use it without an article and if we're
writing it in this sense then we use a
lowercase e these patterns are
particularly common with idioms and
conversational expressions for example
why on earth didn't you tell me this
means why in the world didn't you tell
me and they're our last example she'd
move heaven and earth for her children's
happiness it's just an expression
it means she'd do just about anything in
her power or in her means to make her
children happy
questions one if you had the chance
would you travel to the moon too how
much time do you think you could spend
in space
[Music]
this is the end of part 1 before you go
on to part 2 I'd like to invite you to
English cafe comm where additional
practice for the first half of our
lesson is available under the name
Jennifer ESL follow the link in the
video description
